citeinfo.title: Assumptions and practical considerations in the design and interpretation of echolocation-monitoring studies
citeinfo.othercit: Science Information System Project #:5003389 Publication Control #:901

descript.abstract: Bat detectors are now commonly being used in studies of the behavior and ecology of bats. Use of bat detectors in these studies involves a number of assumptions, most of which are generally not stated explicitly, and some of which are apparently not recognized by researchers. This paper identifies six key assumptions inherent to most echolocation-monitoring studies. It is important to account for temporal, spatial, and sampling variation to meet the underlying assumptions in echolocation-monitoring studies.
